text: Bubba Wallace has been in the news recently as he won the first of two Duel at Daytona qualifying races on Thursday, alongside Austin Cindric. This set him up for Sunday’s season-opening Daytona 500. While his career as a stock car driver is well documented, details about his personal life remain relatively unknown. So, who is Bubba Wallace’s wife and how many kids do they have? Here is everything to know about Wallace’s spouse, their kids, and the couple’s relationship history. Who is Bubba Wallace’s wife? Bubba Wallace’s wife is Amanda Carter. Carter pursued her education at Appalachian State University where she attained a bachelor’s degree in finance and banking. As per USA Network, she served as a financial analyst at the Bank of America. Carter also held the position of Vice President at Alpha Pi International Fraternity. (via Sportskeeda) Currently, Carter is working as an artist and runs an Instagram page, @mandyinthestudio, displaying her works. How many kids do Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter have? Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter are proud parents to one kid. The couple welcomed their first child on September 29, 2024, and shared the news via a joint Instagram post. They named their child, Becks Hayden. Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter’s relationship history Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter first crossed paths in high school. In an interview with People, Wallace opened up on their meeting stating, ”She thought I was nice, but not attractive.” He further said, “I just remember seeing her, and I was like, ‘Wow, she’s beautiful.”’ Following their graduation from high school, the duo continued to stay in touch as friends. Soon, their relationship grew strong and they ended up reconnecting properly at a college football game in 2015. Further, Wallace ended up inviting Carter to a race in Las Vegas. After an initial refusal, Wallace eventually agreed and the two slowly fell in love. The duo began dating and the racer proposed to Carter near a waterfall in Oregon in June 2021. The couple tied the knot on New Year’s Eve in 2022 in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Bubba Wallace has been in the news recently as he won the first of two Duel at Daytona qualifying races on Thursday, alongside Austin Cindric. This set him up for Sunday’s season-opening Daytona 500. While his career as a stock car driver is well documented, details about his personal life remain relatively unknown. So, who is Bubba Wallace’s wife and how many kids do they have?

Here is everything to know about Wallace’s spouse, their kids, and the couple’s relationship history.

Who is Bubba Wallace’s wife?

Bubba Wallace’s wife is Amanda Carter.

Carter pursued her education at Appalachian State University where she attained a bachelor’s degree in finance and banking. As per USA Network, she served as a financial analyst at the Bank of America. Carter also held the position of Vice President at Alpha Pi International Fraternity. (via Sportskeeda)

Currently, Carter is working as an artist and runs an Instagram page, @mandyinthestudio, displaying her works.

How many kids do Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter have?

Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter are proud parents to one kid.

The couple welcomed their first child on September 29, 2024, and shared the news via a joint Instagram post. They named their child, Becks Hayden.

Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter’s relationship history

Bubba Wallace and Amanda Carter first crossed paths in high school. In an interview with People, Wallace opened up on their meeting stating, ”She thought I was nice, but not attractive.” He further said, “I just remember seeing her, and I was like, ‘Wow, she’s beautiful.”’ Following their graduation from high school, the duo continued to stay in touch as friends.

Soon, their relationship grew strong and they ended up reconnecting properly at a college football game in 2015. Further, Wallace ended up inviting Carter to a race in Las Vegas. After an initial refusal, Wallace eventually agreed and the two slowly fell in love.

The duo began dating and the racer proposed to Carter near a waterfall in Oregon in June 2021. The couple tied the knot on New Year’s Eve in 2022 in Charlotte, North Carolina.
